newsitem.title: CANADA: WCE canola ends at lows on fund, commercial sales.
newsitem.headline: WCE canola ends at lows on fund, commercial sales.

text.p: WCE canola ended down and at its lows on fund and commercial selling, traders said.

"Funds sold 1,000 July late in the day, locals were short, there were enough commission sell stops to feed on themselves and commercials sold July," a trader said. July WCE futures crush margin fell to -4.75 Tuesday from -3.07 Monday. Sep-Nov spread at $3.20, Aug-Nov $33.50, July-Nov $32.
Japan bought 1,000-2,000 tonnes overnight, sources said.
July canola fell $8.60 to $409.50, November down $7.60 to $379.40. July flax fell $1.90 to $331.10, November lost $0.50 to $320.50 on long liquidation, light new crop hedges.
PCTS sold July feed wheat down $0.30 to $158.30 to UGG, December lost $0.40 to $160.40, traders said. July-Dec spread at $2. Volume was 688 lots.
July western barley lost $2.30 to $134.70 on closing hedges, October fell $2.50 at $135.50. Fifty July-Oct spread at $1. Volume was 700 lots.
"The (Canadian) Wheat Board's going to need more barley if they're doing this Saudi business, that's why the spread's coming in," a barley trader said.
Traders said the CWB sold at least 150,000 tonnes in Saudi Arabia's 700,000 tonne tender Monday at US$145 FOB Vancouver.
RBC-DS and a commercial sold 100 October peas down US$1 at US$190.50, traders said. Commercials sold 10 July oats down US$4 to US$112.50 and 10 October down the US$5 a tonne limit to US$111.50.
(All prices in Canadian dollars/tonne except oats, peas).
